reg32.name: BUF_INFO
reg32.doc: Pitch (actually, appears to be pitch in bytes, so really is a stride) in GMEM, so pitch of the current tile.

reg32.name: RB_COPY_DEST_PITCH
reg32.doc: actually, appears to be pitch in bytes, so really is a stride

reg32.name: RB_DEPTH_CONTROL
reg32.doc: Z_READ_ENABLE bit is set for zfunc other than GL_ALWAYS or GL_NEVER

reg32.name: RB_DEPTH_INFO
reg32.doc: DEPTH_BASE is offset in GMEM to depth/stencil buffer, ie bin_w * bin_h / 1024 (possible rounded up to multiple of something?? ie. 39 becomes 40, 78 becomes 80.. 75 becomes 80.. so maybe it needs to be multiple of 8??

reg32.name: RB_DEPTH_PITCH
reg32.doc: stride of depth/stencil buffer

reg32.name: RB_STENCIL_INFO
reg32.doc: Base address for stencil when not using interleaved depth/stencil

reg32.name: RB_STENCIL_PITCH
reg32.doc: pitch of stencil buffer when not using interleaved depth/stencil

bitset.name: a4xx_sp_vs_fs_ctrl_reg0
bitset.doc: The full/half register footprint is in units of four components, so if r0.x is used, that counts as all of r0.[xyzw] as used. There are separate full/half register footprint values as the full and half registers are independent (not overlapping). Presumably the thread scheduler hardware allocates the full/half register names from the actual physical register file and handles the register renaming.

reg32.name: REG
reg32.doc: These seem to be offsets for storage of the varyings. Always seems to start from 8, possibly loc 0 and 4 are for gl_Position and gl_PointSize?

reg32.name: SP_VS_OBJ_OFFSET_REG
reg32.doc: From register spec: SP_FS_OBJ_OFFSET_REG.CONSTOBJECTSTARTOFFSET [16:24]: Constant object start offset in on chip RAM, 128bit aligned

reg32.name: REG
reg32.doc: These seem to be offsets for storage of the varyings. Always seems to start from 8, possibly loc 0 and 4 are for gl_Position and gl_PointSize?

reg32.name: REG
reg32.doc: These seem to be offsets for storage of the varyings. Always seems to start from 8, possibly loc 0 and 4 are for gl_Position and gl_PointSize?

reg32.name: REG
reg32.doc: Configures the mapping between VSC_PIPE buffer and bin, X/Y specify the bin index in the horiz/vert direction (0,0 is upper left, 0,1 is leftmost bin on second row, and so on). W/H specify the number of bins assigned to this VSC_PIPE in the horiz/vert dimension.

reg32.name: VFD_CONTROL_0
reg32.doc: TOTALATTRTOVS is # of attributes to vertex shader, in register slots (ie. vec4+vec3 -> 7)
BYPASSATTROVS seems to count varyings that are just directly assigned from attributes (ie, "vFoo = aFoo;")
STRMDECINSTRCNT is # of VFD_DECODE_INSTR registers valid
STRMFETCHINSTRCNT is # of VFD_FETCH_INSTR registers valid

reg32.name: VFD_CONTROL_1
reg32.doc: MAXSTORAGE could be # of attributes/vbo's

reg32.name: INSTR
reg32.doc: SHIFTCNT appears to be size, ie. FLOAT_32_32_32 is 12, and BYTE_8 is 1

reg32.name: PC_VSTREAM_CONTROL
reg32.doc: SIZE is current pipe width * height (in tiles)
N is some sort of slot # between 0..(SIZE-1). In case multiple tiles use same pipe, each tile gets unique slot #

bitfield.name: VAROUT
bitfield.doc: in groups of 4x vec4, blob only uses values 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8

reg32.doc: Pitch in bytes (so actually stride)
Pitch in bytes (so actually stride)
